reasoning: Fulminant hepatitis (acute liver failure within 8 weeks) incidence estimated at ~1.2 per 100k globally. Highly heterogeneous etiologies (viral hepatitis A/B/E, drug-induced, autoimmune) with significant geographic variation (0.1-0.5 per 100k in developed countries; 1-2 per 100k in developing countries with high HBV/HEV burden).
source: Estimated from hepatology literature and regional hospital registries including WHO reports on liver disease epidemiology
